On Escalation Ticket # 00426022 the new comment has been added: Alex Puskas:

@WaitingOnEngineer

This was replicated on Windows 11 (on windows 10 eveything works as expected).


!!! this is a very important information which was NOT wrote in ticket

A ticket was linked with this item which will solve the problem. Until the PM will schedule the ticket for a release a workaround solution can be used.
 @Krzysztof Staszalek

Workaround: set denylist application

Denylists and Allowlist -> Denylists -> Applications -> Add

Application & CLI Command: SnippingTool
Parameters: *

Check in right panel and click on Generate.

[DevOps CommentId:11566739]

On Escalation Ticket # 00426022 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Status has been changed to Awaiting Client.

On Escalation Ticket # 00426022 the new comment has been added: Hello @Alex,

The customer didn't change anything on the EPP side. There is another process that is opening the screenshot function called ScreenSkatch.exe 
We have tried to block this as before by adding it to the denylist, without success. 
From my search this process is part of another process that has multiple functionalities.
A set logs has been added also a screenshot.

On Escalation Ticket # 00426022 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Status has been changed to Awaiting R&D.

On Escalation Ticket # 00426022 the new comment has been added: Hello, 

Customer also tried to use the button and save the screenshot to check if the image is black or contain details and it contains details.

On Escalation Ticket # 00426022 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Status has been changed to Awaiting Escalating Engineer.

On Escalation Ticket # 00426022 the new comment has been added: Alex Puskas:

@WaitingOnEngineer
A bug was discovered while testing this issue, and the customer is correct that the screenshot is NOT blocked (it works).

Until we fix the issue, please add the following executables to the application denylist:
ScreenSketch.exe *

ScreenClippingHost.exe" *
GameBar.exe *

!! All the time please add the * like arguments.

Please test with the mentioned process names.
